ui.title: Takedown Request Builder
ui.select_platform_desc: Select the platform where the incident occurred to begin.
ui.generic_builder_desc: Provide details about the incident to generate a standardized takedown request document.
ui.placeholder_incident_desc: Please describe what happened without sharing overly sensitive personal data...
ui.error_desc_required: Please provide a description of the incident to generate the document.

pdf.title: Formal Online Harassment / Takedown Request
pdf.subject: Subject: Formal Takedown Request regarding Online Harassment
pdf.intro: I am writing to formally request the removal of content or action regarding an incident on your platform.
pdf.closing: This request is made in accordance with digital safety guidelines and platform policies regarding user safety and harassment.

youtube.name: YouTube
youtube.overview: YouTube provides tools to report cyberbullying, harassment, and other policy violations. You can report specific videos, comments, or entire channels.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the video or comment in question.
screenshots.1: Screenshot of the channel profile page.
screenshots.2: Screenshot of any direct messages or interactions (if applicable).

tips.0: Include the direct URL of the video or comment.
tips.1: Be specific about which part of the video violates policies.
tips.2: Do not engage with the harasser directly in the comments.

tiktok.name: TikTok
tiktok.overview: TikTok has a dedicated safety center for reporting hate speech, harassment, and bullying. Reports are anonymous.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the video or live stream.

tips.0: Use the "Report" button directly on the content.
tips.1: Provide context if the harassment is part of a trend or challenge.
tips.2: Save the video link before it gets deleted or hidden.

snapchat.name: Snapchat
snapchat.overview: Snapchat allows users to report snaps, stories, and profiles that involve harassment or bullying.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the Snap (be aware that Snapchat notifies users of screenshots).

tips.1: Use the long-press feature on a Snap or Chat to report it quickly.
tips.2: Contact local law enforcement if there is immediate danger.

instagram.name: Instagram
instagram.overview: Instagram offers various ways to report bullying, harassment, and impersonation. You can report posts, stories, profiles, and comments.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the post or story.

tips.0: Use the "Restrict" feature to limit interactions without blocking.
tips.1: Report impersonation accounts through the specific impersonation form.
tips.2: Keep a record of the report confirmation.

facebook.name: Facebook
facebook.overview: Facebook encourages users to report content that violates Community Standards, including bullying and harassment.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the post, photo, or comment.
screenshots.1: Screenshot of the profile or page.

tips.0: Use the "Find Support or Report" option on the content.
tips.1: You can report on behalf of someone else if they are being impersonated.
tips.2: Block the user after reporting to prevent further contact.

discord.name: Discord
discord.overview: Discord takes harassment seriously. You can report messages directly to their Trust & Safety team.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the message(s) including the timestamp.
screenshots.1: Screenshot of the User ID (enable Developer Mode in settings).
screenshots.2: Screenshot of the Server ID (if applicable).

tips.0: Do not delete the messages before reporting, as Discord needs message links/IDs.
tips.1: Report the user via their profile if they are sending unwanted DMs.
tips.2: Involve server moderators if the harassment is happening in a specific server.

x.name: X (Twitter)
x.overview: X allows you to report accounts and posts for abusive behavior, harassment, and hate speech.

tips.0: You can report multiple posts in a single report.
tips.1: Use the "Mute" or "Block" features to stop seeing content.
tips.2: Provide as much context as possible in the details section.

twitch.name: Twitch
twitch.overview: Twitch users can report streamers or viewers for harassment, hate speech, and other violations during broadcasts or in chat.

screenshots.1: Screenshot of the stream if the violation is visual.

tips.0: Use the "Report" button in the chat or on the channel page.
tips.1: Provide the specific timestamp and date of the incident.
tips.2: Channel moderators can also assist with immediate chat issues.

xbox.name: Xbox Party Chat
xbox.overview: Xbox allows users to report voice and text harassment occurring in party chats or games.

screenshots.0: Photo or screenshot of the text message.
screenshots.2: Report the voice clip if the console allows for voice reporting.

tips.0: Use the "Report" feature directly from the player's profile.
tips.1: Specify if the harassment occurred in a Party or during a game.
tips.2: Keep your console software updated for the latest safety features.

playstation.name: PlayStation Party Chat
playstation.overview: Sony provides reporting tools for the PlayStation Network to handle harassment in party chats and messages.

screenshots.1: Photo of the screen if a screenshot isn't possible.
screenshots.2: Note the PSN ID of the offender.

tips.0: Report through the "Options" menu on the message or player profile.
tips.1: Ensure you are reporting the specific content that is harmful.
tips.2: Block the PSN ID to stop receiving communications.

tumblr.name: Tumblr
tumblr.overview: Tumblr has policies against harassment and bullying. You can report posts, blogs, and messages.

screenshots.0: Screenshot of the post or blog.
screenshots.1: Screenshot of the ask or message.

tips.0: Use the "Report" link found on the post or blog.
tips.1: Specify the nature of the abuse (e.g., harassment, hate speech).
tips.2: You can also block the blog to prevent them from interacting with you.

viber.name: Viber
viber.overview: Viber allows users to report messages and accounts that engage in spam or harassment.

screenshots.1: Screenshot of the sender's phone number or profile info.

tips.0: Tap and hold a message to find the "Report" option.
tips.1: Block the number immediately after reporting.
tips.2: Be careful with sharing personal info in public communities.
